name: Anthurium papillilaminum
description: Anthurium papillilaminum Ã— dressleri is a hybrid Anthurium, a cross between Anthurium papillilaminum and Anthurium dressleri. It is an epiphytic plant native to tropical regions, with this particular hybrid form originating from Indonesia. It belongs to the Araceae family and features upright stems (30-60 cm tall) with large, dramatic, arrow-shaped to heart-shaped, velvety, dark green leaves with distinctive venation. The plant displays an upright, bushy growth habit. Many species have velvety leaves with prominent white or silver veins that create stunning contrast, and some produce fragrant blooms. In tropical forests, this plant typically grows as an epiphyte on tree trunks, receiving filtered sunlight through the dense canopy. In its native habitat, it grows on tree branches in tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds natural beauty with its distinctive velvety foliage. It's popular among Anthurium enthusiasts for its attractive leaves.
careTips: Keep soil consistently moist but well-draining
Toxic if ingested - keep away from pets and children
Bright indirect light for best flowering
